cards.rules_text:
Driver—Each creature in your starting deck is a Pilot and it contains ten or more Vehicles. [i](If this card outside the game is your chosen driver, you may swap it with a card in your opening hand.)[/i]
[+1]: Create a 2/2 colorless Vehicle artifact token named Osiris MV with flying and engineer 2. 
[0]: Untap up to one target artifact and up to one target land.
[-6]: Search your library for up to three Vehicle cards and put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle. You get an emblem with “Vehicles you control have engineer 0.”

Kicker—Sacrfice an artifact.

cards.notes:
"Companions and Companion alikes
Symmetry and Geometry, the whole Xerex thing (Invasion of Xerex; Xerex Strobe-Knight)
Racecars (Ford vs. Ferrari, Hot Wheels, Talladega Nights)
Weird looking art
I kind of miss Planeswalker cards and love a cool looking art popout
Guesses at what Magic cards might look like 5 years from now
Any type of weird magic frame
I tend to like controlling/grindy cards that accrue a lot of value over the course of a game rather than big one time effects."

cards.rules_text:
As this enchantment enters, choose XVX or Osiris.
• XVX — Whenever you cast a permanent spell, this enchantment deals 2 damage to any target.
• Osiris — Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, create a 1/1 red Pilot artifact creature token with “{T}: Add {R}.”

When this creature enters, gain control of up to one target artifact until end of turn. Untap it. If it's a Vehicle, it becomes an
artifact creature and gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Dude, just destroy the counter-magic seal, it's that easy.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Choose two —
• Counter target spell.
• Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.
• Kiss Goodbye deals 4 damage to target creature.
• Target player creates two 1/1 white Human creature tokens and a Treasure token.

Kicker {1}{R}
If this spell was kicked, search your library for
a card with mana value equal to a spell on the stack, reveal it, put into your hand, then shuffle.
You may exile a card from your hand. If you do, counter up to one target spell with mana value equal to the exiled card, then draw a card.

Flash
This Vehicle can't block.
When this Vehicle enters, counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Engineer 2 [i](At the beginning of each combat,[/i]
[i]if you've spent at least two mana this turn, you may have this Vehicle become an artifact creature until end of turn.)[/i]

Multikicker {1}{U}
Draw a card, then draw an additional card for each time this spell was kicked.

At the beginning of your end step, put a lap counter on this enchantment. You may return target Vehicle card with mana value less than or equal to the number of lap counters on this enchantment from your graveyard to your hand. If you don't, surveil 1.

Kicker—Sacrifice an artifact. [i](You may sacrifice an artifact in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)[/i]
Destroy target creature if its power is 2 or less. If this spell was kicked, destroy that creature if its power is 4 or less instead.

fewer than five -1/-1 counters on enchanted permanent, put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted permanent.

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {R}.

As this artifact enters, look at target player's hand, then choose a card name.
Whenever a player casts a spell with the chosen name, counter that spell and that player draws a card.

cards.rules_text:
{T}, Sacrifice another permanent: Create a Treasure token.
{2}{R}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice two other permanents: Create a 4/4 red Vehicle artifact token with haste and engineer 4. [i](At the beginning of each combat, if you've spent at least four mana[/i]
[i]this turn, you may have that token become an artifact creature until end of turn.)[/i]

When this creature enters, mill four cards.
Whenever one or more cards leave your graveyard, you draw a card and you lose 1 life. This ability triggers only once each turn.

As this enchantment enters, choose XVX or Osiris.
• XVX — When this enchantment enters and at the beginning of your upkeep, mill two cards. You may put a permanent card from among the milled cards into your hand.
• Osiris — At the beginning of combat on your turn, up to one target permanent becomes a 4/4 Vehicle artifact creature in addition to its other types until your next turn.
Search your library for a Vehicle card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

When this enchantment enters, destroy up to one target artifact or enchantment.
{3}{G}{G}, Sacrifice this enchantment: Search your library for a basic land card or Circuit card, put it onto the battlefield,
then shuffle.

When this enchantment enters, creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield. If you don't put it onto the battlefield, exile it. You may play it until your next turn.

Flash
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may return a creature you control to its owner's hand. If you do, untap up to two target artifacts and/or lands.

If a player would be promised a gift, each player is promised that gift instead.
{T}: Each player exiles the top card of their library face down. For the rest of the game, any player may pay {2}. If they do, they put a card they exiled this way into their hand.
